Class PietsGrafieken.FunctionNameColorRfPhi

java.lang.Object
pietsgrafieken.PietsGrafieken.PietsFunction<Double>
pietsgrafieken.PietsGrafieken.FunctionNameColorRfPhi
Enclosing class:
PietsGrafieken
public static class PietsGrafieken.FunctionNameColorRfPhi extends PietsGrafieken.PietsFunction<Double>
represents a Function in polar coordinates: r = f(phi) 
The point (x,y) is then calculated as
     . x = r * cos(phi)
     . y = r * sin(phi)

    Path2D
    createPath(int nrOfPoints)
    creates a Path2D.Double, by dividing the supplied domain into the supplied nrOfPoints and calculatoing the value of each of those points.

  • Constructor Details

    • FunctionNameColorRfPhi

      public FunctionNameColorRfPhi(Function<Double,Double> f, String name, Color c, double phiMin, double phiMax)
      constructor
      Parameters:
      f - the Function<Double, Double> r = f(phi)
      name - the name of this function, displayed in the graph
      c - the color of this function in the graph
      phiMin - double, the minimum value for which the function will be applied
      phiMax - ouble, the maximum value for which the function will be applied 
       use: var f = new FunctionNameColorRfPhi(
          fi -> 3 * cos(fi * 3, 
          "r = 3cos(phi)",
          Color.BLUE,
          -3 * PI,
           3 * PI
      );

      public Path2D createPath(int nrOfPoints) throws RuntimeException
      creates a Path2D.Double, by dividing the supplied domain into the supplied nrOfPoints and calculatoing the value of each of those points.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      nrOfPoints - int, the number of subdivisions of the domain
      Returns:
      Path2D
